page.title: 18Primary School,Paddock Wood
page.content: The school was built in 1909 and is the largest primary school in Kent.There are five blocks in the school.The newest block was built four years ago after the main building was burnt down. In the oldest building there are six classrooms,a library,a museum and an assembly hall.The new building houses nine junior classes as well as an assembly hall,music room,television room,staffroom,cloackrooms and offices. There are three other buildings which house six infant classes,a swimming pool,television room and an art studio. At present there are 611 children who co to the school. There are seven infant classes and twelve junior classes. There are many school clubs such as football,gymnastics,netball, badminton, art and craft,gardening,table tennis, chess,recorder and choir.
